kszucs commented on a change in pull request #3031: (WIP) ARROW-3878: [Rust] Improve primitive types
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3031#discussion_r236165681
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .travis.yml
 ##########
 @@ -267,6 +267,13 @@ matrix:
     - $TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/ci/travis_script_ruby.sh
   # Rust
   - language: rust
+    rust:
+      - stable
+      - nightly
+    matrix:
+      allow_failures:
+        - rust: stable
+      fast_finish: true
 
 Review comment:
   We intentionally run both stable and nightly in a single CI step, see https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2477#issuecomment-416060848

sunchao commented on a change in pull request #3031: ARROW-3878: [Rust] Improve primitive types
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3031#discussion_r237362162
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/src/lib.rs
 ##########
 @@ -15,6 +15,8 @@
 // specific language governing permissions and limitations
 // under the License.
 
+#![feature(specialization)]
 
 Review comment:
   This is used in `BufferBuilder` where we defined a trait `BufferBuilderTrait` (I'm not too happy with this name..) and implemented this separately for `BufferBuilder<T: ArrowNumericType>` and `BufferBuilder<BooleanType>`. Without this, we'd have to implement `PrimitiveArrayBuilder` separately for `ArrowNumericType` and `BooleanType`, with the same code. 

----------------------------------------------------------------

paddyhoran commented on a change in pull request #3031: ARROW-3878: [Rust] Improve primitive types
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3031#discussion_r237569338
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/src/array.rs
 ##########
 @@ -24,7 +24,7 @@ use std::sync::Arc;
 
 use array_data::*;
 use buffer::*;
 
 Review comment:
   I there is a need to use the `use <module>::*` pattern for `builder` and `datatypes` (and `array`) because they define a lot of types, but maybe we should avoid this for `array_data` and `buffer`?

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Currently we simply uses Rust's native types as primitive types, and relies on macros such as [this|https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/rust/src/array.rs#L298] to link the Arrow data type with the native type. A better approach may be to define richer primitive types which contain both the Arrow type and the Rust native type, as well as other information such as type's bit width, precision, etc.
